i.name: Arcane Mastery
i.description: <mainText>Ryze's spells deal extra damage based on his Bonus Mana, and he gains a percentage increase to his maximum Mana based on his Ability Power.</mainText>

q.name: Overload
q.description:
Passively, Ryze's other damaging spells reset Overload and begin to charge a Rune that can be used to empower Overload.

On cast, Ryze throws a charge of pure energy in a line, dealing damage to the first enemy struck. If a Rune is fully charged, Ryze also gains a shield and Movement Speed.

w.name: Rune Prison
w.description: Ryze traps a target enemy unit in a cage of runes, damaging them and preventing them from moving.

e.name: Spell Flux
e.description: Ryze releases an orb of pure magical power that damages an enemy and debuffs them. Ryze's spells have additional effects against the debuffed enemy.

r.name: Realm Warp
r.description: Ryze creates a portal to a nearby location. After a few seconds, allies standing near the portal are teleported to the target location.

i1.blurb: Ryze's spells deal extra damage based on his Bonus Mana, and he gains a percentage increase to his maximum Mana based on his Ability Power.
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Ryze''' gains {{as|(5% per 100 AP)}} {{as|{{sti|mana|'''bonus''' mana}}}}.
i1.name: Arcane Mastery
notes: * No additional notes.

riot.name: Arcane Mastery
riot.description: <mainText>Ryze's spells deal extra damage based on his Bonus Mana, and he gains a percentage increase to his maximum Mana based on his Ability Power.</mainText>

riot.name: Overload
riot.description:
Passively, Ryze's other damaging spells reset Overload and begin to charge a Rune that can be used to empower Overload.

On cast, Ryze throws a charge of pure energy in a line, dealing damage to the first enemy struck. If a Rune is fully charged, Ryze also gains a shield and Movement Speed.
riot.tooltip:
Passive: Rune Prison and Spell Flux reset Overload's cooldown and charge a Rune for {{ e2 }} seconds, up to {{ e9 }} Runes.

Active: Unleash a runic blast, dealing {{ e1 }} (+{{ a1 }}) (+{{ f1 }}) magic damage to the first enemy struck. Any active Runes are discharged.

If {{ e9 }} Runes are discharged, they Overload, shielding Ryze from {{ f3 }} (+{{ a2 }}) (+{{ f2 }}) damage and increasing his Movement Speed by {{ e4 }}% for {{ e5 }} seconds.

q1.blurb: Passively, Ryze's other damaging spells reset Overload and begin to charge a Rune that can be used to empower Overload. On cast, Ryze throws a charge of pure energy in a line, dealing damage to the first enemy struck. If a Rune is fully charged, Ryze also gains a shield and Movement Speed.
description: {{sbc|Passive:}} '''Ryze's''' other basic abilities reset {{sti|cdr|''Overload's'' cooldown}} and charge a {{ai|Overload 3||Rune}} for 4 seconds, up to 2.

{{sbc|Active:}} '''Ryze''' unleashes a runic blast in the target direction, dealing {{tip|magic damage|{{as|magic damage}}}} to the first enemy struck and consuming all of his {{ai|Overload 2||Runes}}.

If '''Ryze''' consumes 2 Runes, he {{sti|shields}} himself for {{pp|65 to 150}} {{as|(+ 60% AP)}} {{as|(+ 3% '''bonus''' mana)}} damage for 2 seconds and gains {{sti|ms|{{As|'''bonus''' movement speed}}}} for the duration.
{{sbc|{{ai|Spell Flux|Ryze|Flux:}}}} ''Overload'' deals increased damage, based on ''Spell Flux's'' rank, and spreads to all nearby enemies marked with ''Flux''.
q1.name: Overload
notes: * Apply {{tip|multi-hit}} spell effect to nearby enemies affected by {{ai|Spell Flux|Ryze|Flux}}.
* Killing an enemy, marked with {{ai|Spell Flux|Ryze|Flux}}, with ''Overload'' will only apply {{ai|Spell Flux|Ryze}} to nearby enemies, and not ''Overload's'' damage.

riot.name: Rune Prison
riot.description: Ryze traps a target enemy unit in a cage of runes, damaging them and preventing them from moving.
riot.tooltip: Instantly root an enemy for {{ e1 }} second and deal {{ e2 }} <scaleAP>(+{{ a1 }})</scaleAP> <scaleMana>(+{{ f1 }})</scaleMana> magic damage.

w1.blurb: Ryze traps a target enemy unit in a cage of runes, damaging them and preventing them from moving.
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Ryze''' instantly deals {{as|magic damage}} and {{tip|root|roots}} the target enemy for {{fd|0.75}} seconds.
{{sbc|{{ai|Spell Flux|Ryze|Flux:}}}} ''Rune Prison's'' {{tip|root}} duration is increased to {{fd|1.5}} seconds.
w1.name: Rune Prison
notes: * No additional details.

riot.name: Spell Flux
riot.description: Ryze releases an orb of pure magical power that damages an enemy and debuffs them. Ryze's spells have additional effects against the debuffed enemy.
riot.tooltip:
Apply Flux to an enemy, dealing {{ e1 }} (+{{ a1 }}) (+{{ f1 }}) magic damage. Spells consume Flux for bonus effects:

Overload: Deals {{ e2 }}% more damage and spreads to nearby enemies with Flux.
Rune Prison: Root duration is increased to {{ e6 }} seconds.
Spell Flux: Spreads Spell Flux to nearby enemies, dealing {{ e8 }}% damage.

Spells that kill enemies affected by Flux spread Spell Flux to nearby enemies.

e1.blurb: Ryze releases an orb of pure magical power that damages an enemy and debuffs them. Ryze's spells have additional effects against the debuffed enemy.
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Ryze''' hurls an orb of runic energy at the target enemy, dealing {{as|magic damage}} and marking them with ''Flux'' for 3 seconds, causing his next basic ability against them to consume the mark and gain bonus effects.
{{sbc|{{ai|Spell Flux|Ryze|Flux:}}}} ''Spell Flux'' spreads to all nearby enemies, dealing 50% damage and marking them with ''Flux''.
Enemies killed by any of '''Ryze's''' abilities while marked with ''Flux'' also spread ''Flux'' to nearby enemies.
e1.effect_radius: {{tt|325|Bounce range for Overload and Spell Flux (centered range)}}
e1.name: Spell Flux
notes: * ''Spell Flux's'' second cast on a target will apply a new ''Flux'' debuff as well as triggering the previous one (effectively refreshing the duration).
* Apply {{tip|multi-hit}} spell effect to nearby enemies when spreading ''Flux'' to nearby enemies.

riot.name: Realm Warp
riot.description: Ryze creates a portal to a nearby location. After a few seconds, allies standing near the portal are teleported to the target location.
riot.tooltip:
Ryze opens a portal to a location up to {{ e7 }} range away. After {{ e4 }} seconds, all allies near the portal are teleported to that location.

If Ryze becomes unable to cast or move, Realm Warp is cancelled.

r1.blurb: Ryze creates a portal to a nearby location. After a few seconds, allies standing near the portal are teleported to the target location.
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Ryze''' opens a portal on the ground at his current location and begins {{ct|channel|channeling|attack=true|move=true|cast=true|items=true,,interrupts|root=true|spells=true,true,true,true|death=revival-false}}. If '''Ryze''' successfully channels for 2 seconds, all allied units within the portal {{tip|blink}} to the target location and very briefly become {{tip|untargetable}}. ''Realm Warp'' can affect untargetable allies.
''Realm Warp'' can only be ranked up twice, with ranks available at levels 6 and 11. Instead, {{ai|Overload|Ryze}} has 6 ranks.
r1.name: Realm Warp
notes: * ''Realm Warp'' will try to predict whether an ally is trying to run out of it or not and will not teleport allies that are very near the edge and move click outside of it.
* {{tip|Untargetable}} effect lasts approximately {{fd|0.75}} seconds.
* Teleported units retain the same relative positions to one another upon arrival.
* '''Ryze''' will not teleport if he exits the area, but the teleport will still occur for other allies so long as Ryze isn't interrupted.
* {{tip|Ground}} will both prevent '''Ryze''' from activating, as well as prevent units from being teleported, but will not interrupt the channel.

* Allied {{tip|stasis}} effects will '''not''' interrupt ''Realm Warp's'' channel - excluding {{ii|Zhonya's Hourglass}} and {{ii|Stopwatch}} - like the passive of {{ii|Guardian Angel}} or an allied {{cai|Tempered Fate|Bard}}. Other allies untargetable by similar effects will also be teleported.
** A hostile {{cai|Tempered Fate|Bard}} will interrupt the channel.
* ''Realm Warp's'' interaction with channelled abilities seems to be case-by-case:

** The following channels will prevent the caster from being teleported: {{si|Teleport}}, {{si|Recall}} and {{ai|Ace in the Hole|Caitlyn}}. They will not, however, interrupt the channel (e.g. if Ryze uses Teleport).

** The following channels do not prevent you getting teleported and are '''not''' interrupted: {{ai|Crowstorm|Fiddlesticks}}{{tt|*|When Fiddlesticks' channel resolves, he will blink the full distance to his own target location regardless of how far away Ryze has taken him.}}, {{ai|Requiem|Karthus}} and {{ai|Absolute Zero|Nunu}}.
** ''These lists are not complete.''
* Ryze can teleport {{ci|Zac}} during his {{ai|Cell Division}}, moving both his ''blobbies'' as well as the point where they are attempting to converge.
